DAC9CD9F92664C7A9DDA62B64A5FAA61.description: develop and/or select pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in health care, for inclusion in a portfolio (e.g., work logs, skills checklist, assignments, projects).

94B14487275745979A639331D617FD7E.description: demonstrate an understanding of the work habits that are important for success in the health care industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, self-advocacy, organization);

5689DD09380A49389C8676F27A9B675F.description: demonstrate an understanding of the Essential Skills that are important for success in the health care industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., reading text, finding information, problem solving)

92EB1487D53547BA9E0492324B8CA3D4.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the health care industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations)

D1D3CD1F27EE415DB5DD4881602576C9.description: identify opportunities for volunteering in the health care field, including child-related services, and identify possible requirements (e.g., immunization and TB testing, safety training, completion of an orientation program, police record check);

6283BF84597C4909BA02C2BDDAAD5B5F.description: describe the postsecondary education, training, and certification required for entry into a variety of health care careers;

2E03CC67AA4E40859F7A3DAFDD3B6FB0.description: identify career opportunities in the health care field and describe the roles and responsibilities of workers in these occupations (e.g., dentists, laboratory technologists, nurses, paramedics, recreational therapists, nutritionists, early childhood educators, massage therapists, pediatricians);

F45E77EEA5134F8F84D657763B6F6BE8.description: Career Opportunities: identify and describe career opportunities in health care and the postsecondary education and training required for entry into these occupations.

8AF8297BFFA8448CA06C8625E8B4E595.description: use protective clothing and equipment as required to keep themselves and others safe and free from harm.

12FB1C91CC89446FBF51486EF815D319.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply safe procedures for the use of tools and equipment, as outlined in safety manuals, operating instructions, and institutional requirements;

5435432B704B48B0B2384EF256074A82.description: comply with legislation, regulations, and standards pertaining to health and safety in the workplace;

23C1484E06F64FAE9AEC9514DCA61D21.description: identify and explain the importance of legislation, regulations, information systems, and oversight bodies concerned with protecting the health and safety of workers in the health care workplace (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS], Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB]);

05317607ADB2400C8059435188FCD11F.description: Health and Safety: identify and apply health and safety legislation and safe working practices relating to the health care industry;

6B59E4957CAD4B5FB60BB7640BE8FFFC.description: identify current child and adolescent health issues in developing countries from recent media coverage (e.g., malnutrition, lack of effective immunization programs, lack of clean water).

FDD551D922FF48598583E14269FC5CF1.description: describe current issues related to the delivery of health care services in Canada (e.g., standards, access to care, waiting times; lack of health care support, sanitation, and clean water in remote communities);

DDD5D10BFF02421B9758930F9D65FA02.description: identify current child and adolescent health issues from recent media coverage (e.g., lack of exercise, poor diet, and child obesity; adult alcoholism and fetal alcohol syndrome; poverty and malnourishment);

632200D1ACAE406180A247A070B09206.description: Health Care and Society: describe social trends and health care issues relating to children and adolescents

FFB8B1EDBE4647DEADA7061CEC732AC1.description: describe the impact of health-related choices on the environment, and create a plan for improving personal health and fitness that also benefits the environment (e.g., walking or biking rather than driving; eating more locally produced fruits and vegetables and less meat and processed food).

FE6D9E2AF30241EB9AA90C8C09C03BB2.description: identify current environmental issues and describe their implications for human health and well-being (e.g., air quality and respiratory disease, water quality and gastrointestinal problems, toxic substances and cancer or birth defects);

6FFE33A8A5FC4E28903FAD7332EAA3B1.description: Health Care and the Environment : demonstrate an understanding of environmental issues related to health care and personal well-being;

647FDF36D79F4972BDF6436850ABC17F.description: Health Care, The Environment, and Society

FF3FA38E1A76454B99D796C1C6DAA51F.description: demonstrate competence (e.g., through role play) in using procedures for controlling bleeding and treating cuts, abrasions, sprains, fractures, burns, and loss of consciousness.

7D3DB204E6F044F18788EA9D0E1E696E.description: demonstrate competence (e.g., through role play) in emergency scene management and in the performance of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and interventions for choking and anaphylactic shock;

A0BF44C6C7ED4C7D9FA8EF38DC70EC97.description: First Aid: demonstrate the ability to perform basic first aid procedures.

7AA29AF72D9649B7953B8B2957669092.description: demonstrate an understanding of common health care terms (e.g., resuscitation, anaphylactic shock, syringe, stethoscope, immunization, therapy, asepsis, malnutrition), and use them correctly in oral and written communication.

377004B653A8485D8EEF325B3E379BF2.description: demonstrate the ability (e.g., through role play) to apply a conflict resolution approach, and list the benefits of conflict resolution skills

AF7C05A2C2E34E189F6FB1684E2A1099.description: describe linguistic and cultural communication barriers (e.g., concepts of personal space [how close you stand to someone], avoidance of eye contact, women not speaking to men), and apply techniques for overcoming them (e.g., using action signs to communicate with those who can't speak or read English, using a well-organized message);

3D6ED7C5541C47ED858E3767576F3FB2.description: demonstrate an understanding (e.g., through role play, simulation, or case studies) of the importance of both verbal and non-verbal communication techniques (e.g., verbal: questioning, active listening; non-verbal: body language, sign language, reading Braille);

20865E8516E74B0890971C6CC8DE6D60.description: Communication Techniques: demonstrate competence in the use of health care terminology and techniques for facilitating communication with clients;

7A395198E73C4343A131D274B6A2EEB7.description: design a menu that is suited to the needs of children or adolescents at a particular stage of development, that uses foods from the four food groups of Canada's Food Guide, and that is appropriate to the needs of a specific cultural group.

415F93D40CF443CCA3741B093F37FF6A.description: perform a personal dietary analysis and suggest changes to personal dietary habits, using criteria presented in Canada's Food Guide (e.g., portion size and caloric intake);

6AB16EE62F76441CA888A03D6B42988F.description: identify the major topics covered by Canada's Food Guide (e.g., food groupings, food guide servings, nutritional labelling information), and describe the information that can be obtained from the guide and related resources (e.g., Eating Well with Canada's Food Guide; Eating Well with Canada's Food Guide: First Nations, Inuit and MÃ©tis; cultural adaptations of Canada's Food Guide available from the Ontario Public Health Association);

C92094F3A3094D0CA3AE70C82B554426.description: Nutrition and Meal Planning Using Canada's Food Guide: demonstrate an understanding of and apply sound nutritional practices, as described in Canada's Food Guide;

E492C240C7534766910D4000D8BAA487.description: design a game or entertainment activity that is appropriate to a specific culture and age or stage of development (e.g., activity centre-based games for children, purposeful storytelling for multicultural celebrations)

A4DF4A0627C046D1A0F7AF2A0624B96E.description: identify common play space hazards, and design a safe play space for children of a specific age group;

3C284DDD2A19454D950A408430F875D0.description: create a recreational activity for either a child or an adolescent that is age appropriate and safe and that promotes a health, fitness, or social objective (e.g., a fitness program using resistance bands or balloon volleyball for a child or adolescent with a disability, a music performance by students for an elementary school or day care centre);

604FD7632F214C258B6DFF4FD1BB8CBF.description: Recreational Activities: develop and use a variety of age-appropriate recreational activities to promote safe and healthy play for children and adolescents;

E1A77EF1C7154B5AA2886C92A2CF6233.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply safe procedures for preparing, handling, and storing food in order to reduce or eliminate contaminants (e.g., bacteria, viruses, fungi, parasites) and prevent disease (e.g., salmonella or E. coli infections).

8B94D87CF3674E5890C760BF4E7A7924.description: describe a variety of health care instruments and equipment and demonstrate the ability to use them correctly (e.g., thermometer for body temperature, stethoscope for heart rate and respiration, EpiPen for immediate treatment of allergic reaction);

61EF3F19309A4E8D9825FBF26CB0554E.description: demonstrate an understanding of and perform proper hand-washing techniques to prevent transmission of disease (e.g., preventing the spread of rhinovirus and/or conjunctivitis)

C302EF5834884D109AAE9501166F97F6.description: Asepsis, Hygiene, and Equipment Use: demonstrate an understanding of and apply correct procedures for ensuring asepsis, good hygiene, and proper use of medical equipment;

4B96AA518DD0449BB9933F5C308D099A.description: describe, on the basis of research, services and/or programs that are available in the local community to help children and adolescents deal with abuse and its consequences (e.g., Kids Help Phone, student services, child therapy programs, Aboriginal Head Start).

42174A38FB344B26BFF3DC127E186A03.description: identify signs of abuse (e.g., withdrawal, isolation, aggression, sudden changes in behaviour);

F75439A957E2405F8E5B8BE3B5E3007F.description: describe forms of physical, emotional, verbal, and sexual abuse (e.g., hitting, bullying, name calling and put-downs, date rape, cyberbullying);

56A0EA13792343E393F8983BADC515B8.description: Child and Adolescent Abuse: describe types of abuse that affect children and adolescents, and the community resources available to help victims of abuse.

4F823734AAE143CF8520261661D00780.description: describe the role of play, art, and music therapy in supporting the health and well-being of children and adolescents (e.g., use of drawings to help clients communicate or cope with their feelings).

48F047EF7D2E4C5DA869C3BF7967D131.description: compare conventional and complementary treatment methods for a variety of health care issues (e.g., nicotine patch versus acupuncture for cessation of smoking);

E1EE83ED5D0544FBAF8C56EADAE0EE6A.description: compare conventional and complementary approaches to health care in terms of the therapeutic approaches used (e.g., pharmaceutical medications versus herbal/natural remedies) and the types of practitioners offering the services (e.g., physicians versus homeopaths or Aboriginal healers);

27A8705A987347849A2A5E8FCF4B7EA5.description: Conventional and Complementary Therapies: compare and contrast conventional and complementary therapies and their role in maintaining personal health

06E752C0DBCF4BF28107592EB71A081A.description: develop a personal health plan that promotes healthier lifestyle choices and habits

C3DD9105DE0D47C0A8D84B32DACBE040.description: describe the effects of various sexually transmitted diseases (e.g., chlamydia, genital herpes, syphilis, gonorrhea), and explain how lifestyle factors (e.g., unprotected sex, multiple partners) affect their transmission and prevention;

85041AD8FC56469A8F01014F996234DC.description: explain how lifestyle choices can have an impact on an individual's health and well-being (e.g., sleep habits; nutrition; work/life balance; use of tobacco, alcohol, prescription and illegal drugs);

EF295226B99F4F62823AE83830233697.description: demonstrate a basic understanding of anatomy, organs, and body chemistry (e.g., major bone and muscle structures, major organs and their location and function);

26F365C64D0F425187E9155681427585.description: identify and describe mental health disorders that may affect adolescents (e.g., depression, bipolar disorder, eating disorders, schizophrenia, anxiety disorders, attention deficit disorder [ADD], disorders that are common in certain cultures);

E2856DDB5CB94C4DA653A1F06E0559B6.description: describe situations in which one should seek immediate medical advice (e.g., allergic reactions, any illness with prolonged vomiting and diarrhea);

E9EDA7AAB5554B3396E06DC3F4BC6E0A.description: explain the importance of having regular medical check-ups by a doctor and maintaining immunization protocols (e.g., diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus [DPT] booster; hepatitis A/B vaccine; meningococcal vaccine; human papillomavirus [HPV] prevention vaccine; measles, mumps, rubella [MMR] vaccine; influenza vaccine);

E93F319B5BDD4A488736EBCA66AD84D3.description: describe the benefits of different types of exercise (e.g., aerobic versus strength conditioning) and/or sports, and explain how a regular fitness or sports program can promote good health;

B9A598F1D83D4A24B4E921DBCC58638B.description: demonstrate an understanding of the nutritional needs of children and adolescents and describe the health effects of poor nutrition (e.g., obesity, diabetes, retarded growth, reduced physical and mental efficiency);

E89AA31661A24D71894EA0D14B65C6F4.description: identify factors that affect the personal health and well-being of children and adolescents (e.g., environmental conditions, diet, food safety, food security, adequate shelter, amount of daily exercise, amount of daily rest, recreation opportunities, work/life balance, stress);

3B7C649A7EC4480783AF785467632575.description: Personal Health: describe factors that affect personal health and well-being;

97F479BFFD7740748A937F400D03B9BB.description: describe the health services available in their community (e.g., sexual health clinics, St. John Ambulance branch, crisis centres, substance abuse centres and support groups, public health family programs, Aboriginal healing centres).

F176EA7ACC58443DA393A35D8E88877D.description: describe community resources that provide support to children and adolescents with special needs (e.g., schools for people who are hearing impaired, centres for people who are visually impaired, aquatic programs for children with cerebral palsy);

85A830965EBD4E13976961F25BFD6623.description: describe the roles and responsibilities of various health care providers (e.g., family physicians, medical specialists, registered nurses, registered practical nurses, personal support workers, pharmacists, physiotherapists, Aboriginal traditional healers) and facilities (e.g., acute care facilities, long-term care facilities, mental health facilities, family practices, community outreach facilities) in their community;

D0EFF7BBCD8F49B9B08C531E41023FCB.description: Health Care Services: describe the scope and diversity of health services available in their community;
